nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
### Get your lemlist API key

1. Go to your lemlist account or create one [HERE]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

2. Go to Settings -> Integrations

3. Generate your API Key and copy it

4. On this node, click on create new credential and paste your API key

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
# Read me

This workflow send email replies of your lemlist campaigns to the Slack channel of your choice.

The OpenAI node will classify the reply status. 

The Slack alert is structured in a way that make it easy to read for the user.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: lemlist - Mark as interested
nodes.notes: This httpRequest node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Categorize lemlist reply

parameters.text:
=Classify the [email_content] in one only of the following categories: 

Categories=["Interested", "Out of office", "Unsubscribe", "Not interested", "Other"] 

- Interested is when the reply is positive, and the person want more information or a meeting 

Don't output quotes like in the next example: 
email_content_example:Hey I would like to know more 
category:Interested

email_content:"{{ $json.textClean }}" 

Only answer with JSON in the following format:
{"replyStatus":category}

JSON:

parameters.content:
### Create a Slack notification for each new replies

1. Connect your Slack account by clicking to add Credentials

2. Write the name of the channel where you want to send the Slack alert

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Markdown Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Markdown Workflow. This workflow integrates 12 different services: stickyNote, markdown, httpRequest, chainLlm, outputParserStructured. It contains 22 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 22
- **Node Types**: 12
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Format text with Markdown**: markdown
- **Lemlist Trigger - On new reply**: lemlistTrigger
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **OpenAI Chat Model**: lmChatOpenAi
- **Structured Output Parser**: outputParserStructured
- **Send alert to Slack**: slack
- **Lemlist - Unsubscribe**: lemlist
- **lemlist - Mark as interested**: httpRequest
- **Categorize lemlist reply**: chainLlm
- ... and 12 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
